result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marilyn Marie James

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 11-07-2022

Defendant Marilyn Marie James not in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Marilyn Marie James.  Attorney James Griffin in court on behalf of Attorney Gerald Alder for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Calendar call scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-20-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-03-2022

Defendant Marilyn Marie James appeared by video.  Attorney Angel L Johnson appeared by video for Marilyn Marie James.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Attorney Johnson received a new offer and is requesting additional time to discuss with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marilyn Marie James in court with Attorney Angel L Johnson; both appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Heder. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Ms James is reminded to continue working with Justice Point.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marilyn Marie James in court by telephone with Attorney Angel L Johnson who appears by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant is unable to appear with video and is unable to appear in person due to a foot injury. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marilyn Marie James in court by telephone with Attorney Angel L Johnson who appears in person.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Johnson needs more time to meet with her client. Ms James is to appear in person on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-25-2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marilyn Marie James in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Marilyn Marie James in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marilyn Marie James appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
